perturbation.original_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.changed_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 60 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the payment deadline for lead-finder fees from NET 30 days to NET 60 days. This contradicts the expectation established in other sections of the contract that assume standard payment terms, potentially leading to disputes over when Bravatek should be compensated. There is no defined or described payment term of NET 30 days or NET 60 days, which causes contradiction on what payment term is valid.
perturbation.contradicted_text: When custom Products are designed, developed and to be delivered to Bravatek-identified perspective clients, the parties shall agree to a proposed sales price for use during the project in writing prior to the commencement of each project. 2 For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 60 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.

perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement is twelve (12) months from the date hereof, and will be automatically renewed for one (1) additional twelve month period unless either party shall notify the other in writing of its intention not to renew. Such notice must be given ninety (90) days prior to expiration of the original term.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement is twelve (12) months from the date hereof, and will be automatically renewed for one (1) additional twelve month period unless either party shall notify the other in writing of its intention not to renew. Such notice must be given thirty (30) days prior to expiration of the original term.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the notification period required to prevent automatic renewal from ninety (90) days to thirty (30) days. This contradicts the clause indicating termination upon 90 days written notice, causing uncertainty as to which notice period applies and creating potential disputes over contract duration and termination rights. Since both parties now have different notification period, this will create contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_text: The term of this Agreement is twelve (12) months from the date hereof, and will be automatically renewed for one (1) additional twelve month period unless either party shall notify the other in writing of its intention not to renew. Such notice must be given thirty (30) days prior to expiration of the original term. This Agreement may also be terminated by either party upon ninety (90) days written notice. 3

perturbation.original_text: COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek for direct damages only, excluding any consequential or incidental damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the gross negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its material obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by limiting the scope of indemnification. The modification restricts indemnification to 'direct damages' and requires 'gross negligence or intentional misconduct' for COMPANY's obligations, creating inconsistencies with other sections that don't specify such limitations. Indemnification on the original text is not limited only for 'direct damages', which creates an In-Text Contradiction
perturbation.contradicted_text: COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek for direct damages only, excluding any consequential or incidental damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the gross negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its material obligations under this Agreement. Bravatek shall indemnify COMPANY, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs, incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of Bravatek or breach of Bravatek of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
